revised_title: The Germicidal Action of Ultra-Violet Radiation and its Correlation with Selective Absorption: Addendum
tldr: This article discusses the germicidal action of ultra-violet radiation and its correlation with selective absorption. The authors compare their findings with previous research and demonstrate that the most germicidal region of the ultra-violet spectrum lies between wave-lengths 2940 and 2380. They also highlight the correlation between germicidal action and the selective absorption of lethal radiations by suspensions of bacteria, solutions of protein, and other substances.
